results.title: Australian notebook. No. 5
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine containing the following items: 1. Albert Park Lake proves new attraction for weekend walkers 2. Agriculture Minister Chandler opens a tree-pruning demo at Burnley Horticultural Gardens 3. Labrador retrievers display ability in club trials at Templestowe 4. Fisheries and Game Department supervisors release 20,000 young trout in the Yarra River 5. Sports brief - Lacrosse at Malvern, hockey with Camberwell v Power House for Altona Cup.

results.title: Australian Notebook. No. 2
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine contains historical items of Victorian history including: Country fire fighters in annual event at Chelsea; Veteran cars in rally - Melbourne/Brighton time trial; Ancient petrol rail car service in Melbourne suburb, Vic Rail introduce new suburban train - Blue Train; St Kilda-Brighton Electric tramway celebrates 50 years service.

results.title: Australian modernists 1916-1942
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Features “Down the Hills to Berry’s Bay” : Roland Wakelin’s painting of Post-Impressionist style. “Rhythmic Composition in Yellow Green Minor” : An abstract painting by Roy de Maistre. “Study for Dog Gymkhana”: “Cubism art in Australia”. “Flying Over the Shoalhaven River”: The Work of Margaret Preston.

results.title: Australian Landscape Painters (Italian Version)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian Art”.
The Australian artist has no greater challenge than his own landscape, but few have been completely successful in depicting it. Using both the artists’ words and their work, this film studies such men as Russell Drysdale, Tom Roberts and Sir Heysen, and shows why and how they have transmuted landscape into art

results.title: Australian landscape painters
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian Art”.
The Australian artist has no greater challenge than his own landscape, but few have been completely successful in depicting it. Using both the artists’ words and their work, this film studies Sir Russell Drysdale, Tom Roberts and Sir Hans Heysen, and shows why and how they have transmuted landscape into art.

results.title: Australian is a wide word
results.brief_description: Perhaps the most pertinent issue of this video is why some or many of us have difficulties defining the term “Australian”, particularly in describing ourselves. The title is the response of one person in the video to this issue.

results.title: Australian identity. Yrs 7-10
results.brief_description: A program presented in ten segments on the Australian identity. 1. What’s an identity? 2. What’s an Australian? 3. Popular legends. 4. Aboriginal identity. 5. People left out of our legends. 6. Defiance of authority. 7. The Anzac legend. 8. White colonial Australia. 9. Legends about women. 10. Changing national identity. Uses extracts from early Australian feature films and stills to focus on the question of who are Australians.
